Check out our Service- and Repair Center in Duesseldorf (Germany). 
Nestled in the industrial landscape of Düsseldorf,
Germany, LINDEMANN Metal Recycling‘s 8,000 m2 service
center is one of the best of its kind. For 15 years, this
facility has been at the forefront of revolutionizing the
repair and refurbishment of a range of rotors and other
components. Each component undergoes a rigorous
failure analysis process to ensure it meets or exceeds
original specifications.
Behind the scenes, a dedicated team of more than
20 experts, service technicians, and engineers work
tirelessly with state-of-the-art machinery to uphold
LINDEMANN‘s reputation. Their collective expertise and
commitment to customer satisfaction are the driving
forces behind the Service Center‘s success, enabling
LINDEMANN to consistently deliver outstanding results
to its customers.
🌍 What brings people from across the globe, from Finland to the USA , to Manchester? The LINDEMANN Customer Advisory Board (CAB).To connect. To discover. To bring back value to their clients.

The NxtCut Wing is more than just an upgrade. It’s a bold statement in efficiency, durability, and throughput. Equipped with a powerful wing-type compression box, it takes scrap processing to the next level.

LIDEX scrap shears with side compression are particularly suitable for cutting and compacting heavy and bulky scrap metal. These machines are ideal to reach very high production levels up to 115 t/h with low operating costs. 

The LIDEX is the only scrap shear with side compression to offer a complete automatic cycle that includes discharging of scrap materials from the preload table into the compression box, closing of the box and complete cutting cycle.

The LIDEX allows productivity gains of 25%

LIDEX scrap shear with side compression is particularly suitable for cutting and compacting heavy and bulky scrap metal thanks to the its throat size, its power and side-squeeze force.

These machines are ideal to reach very high production levels up to 115 t/h with low operating costs. They also can be used for baling and can have a pusher with a press force of either 250 tons or 320 tons for an increased densification of the material.

Till now, the LIDEX is the only scrap shear with side compression to offer a complete automatic cycle that includes discharging of scrap materials from the preload table into the compression box, closing of the box and complete cutting cycle.

This unique function is made possible mainly by two major innovations:

innovative kinematics for the preload table which allows dumping of scrap metal directly into the pusher area, and thus reducing the number of movements

a high amplitude lid designed to exert exceptional compaction power and efficiency to reduce cycle times.

The operator who is no longer needed for compression and shearing operations frees up time for carrying out other operations.

The LIDEX allows productivity gains of 25%

A Powerful Machine, Built for the Field

 Equipped with a high-performance 550 hp engine, the Lefort Trax 1250 delivers an impressive cutting force of 1,250 tons. Thanks to its crawler tracks, the machine moves effortlessly across sites, offering unmatched flexibility for both on-site operations and recycling facilities.

But the true game-changer lies in its integrated loading table/hopper. This innovative configuration significantly boosts productivity by allowing continuous feeding of the shear and reducing material handling. During the compression/shearing cycle, the operator can already prepare the next batch by loading the hopper – eliminating idle time.

 
A Concentration of Technology & High-Level Performance

 Equipped with the latest advancements in automation and safety, the Trax 1250 ensures optimal productivity while keeping operating costs to a minimum. A standout feature is its brand-new power unit, designed to allow most maintenance operations to be carried out safely from ground level, enhancing both ease and operator security.

 The unit is also fitted with enhanced soundproofing, drastically reducing noise emissions on site. For added convenience, an optional maintenance platform has been specifically developed to make blade changes easier and more efficient for technicians.

Maximum efficiency, innovative technology and precise material separation

The ArnoShred V sets new standards in shredding technology. Thanks to its unique polyhedron design, it makes optimum use of centrifugal force and ensures highly efficient processing.  

Automatic Material Separation – Save Time, Increase Efficiency
A standout feature of the ArnoShred V is its ability to automatically separate materials with different specific masses – such as plastic and aluminum or copper and iron. This saves valuable time and significantly simplifies downstream sorting processes.

Flexible Adaptation to Individual Requirements
With variable rotor speeds ranging from 600 to 1,200 RPM and a broad drive power spectrum from 2×22 kW to 2×315 kW, the ArnoShred V adapts flexibly to a wide range of applications. Available in different model sizes – from 2,900 × 1,800 × 1,800 mm to larger variants – it can be seamlessly integrated into existing plant concepts.

Maximum Flexibility in the Shredding Process
The ArnoShred V operates in both continuous and batch modes. The particle size of the output material can be individually adjusted to achieve optimal results for various applications. Using state-of-the-art technology, it shreds and fragments a broad range of materials – making it the perfect solution for different industries and applications.

Easy Maintenance – Reduced Operating Costs
The innovative wear-part concept enables customers to perform maintenance and servicing independently – without the need for external specialists. The use of cost-effective, readily available spare parts reduces operating costs and ensures long-term economic efficiency.

Test the ArnoShred V in Our Test Center!
See the power of the ArnoShred V for yourself – test your own materials directly in our test center! We also offer additional processes such as sorting, separation, screening, and grinding. Within a short time, you’ll receive precise results tailored to your specific requirements.

Secure the Future of Shredding Technology!
Contact us for personalized consultation or schedule a test appointment today.

Efficient Vibrating Screen Technology for Maximum Productivity

We present the Vibrating Screen (VS) from ATM Recyclingsystems – the ideal solution for precise material separation in recycling processes.

VS – Powerful Vibrating Screen Technology
The VS stands out with its robust design and variable screen decks, allowing for individual customization to meet your specific requirements. Different mesh sizes ensure efficient separation of various materials, optimizing material processing.

Robust, Durable & Efficient
✔ Reliable continuous operation thanks to high-quality materials
✔ Low maintenance costs due to excellent craftsmanship
✔ Easy integration into existing systems

Technical Highlights of the VS
✅ Screening surfaces: 1,500 × 3,000 mm to 2,000 × 6,000 mm
✅ Mesh sizes: Customizable to your needs
✅ Capacity: Up to 50 t/h (depending on material)
✅ Drive options: Sturdy unbalance motors or motor-driven solutions

Maximum Efficiency for Your Recycling Processes
Benefit from innovative vibrating screen technology and boost your productivity!

ATM Recyclingsystems GmbH, part of the ASCO Group International, has over 80 years of experience in metal recycling. With expertise in engineering, in-house manufacturing, and innovative research, ATM develops and maintains world-class recycling systems for processing secondary raw materials. From comprehensive recycling solutions to global service and spare parts offerings, ATM ensures efficiency and durability in every project.

🔗 For more about our technology and services, visit: www.atm-recyclingsystems.com

The VMG Group, a leading wood processing company in Lithuania, has opened a new veneer plant with an annual capacity of 120,000 m³. To optimize material handling, the company relies on a SENNEBOGEN 825 electric material handler, known for its emission-free operation and energy efficiency.

Want to find out more about the assignment? Read the jobsite report here: https://www.sennebogen.com/en/news/news-press/veneer-plant-electric-material-handler-optimizes-material-logistics sennebogen,material handler,elektrobagger,rundholzaufgabe,roundwood,veneer plant,Furnierwerk

Storm damage along a railway line requires professional tree-felling work on steep slopes. For this, the company Braun relies on the SENNEBOGEN 728 E tree handler, whose 21-meter reach and flexibility enable safe removal of problem vegetation along the route. Equipped with robust attachments like a tree shear and grapple saw, the work is carried out efficiently. Success in this project led to a rent-to-own agreement and additional projects, including along the highway from the Weinsberg interchange to the Bavarian border.

Want to get to know more about the 728 E tree felling expert? Check out our product page: https://www.sennebogen.com/en/products/tree-care-handler/sennebogen-728 sennebogen,fällbagger,tree care handler,baumpflege,tree care,storm damage,Sturmschäden

▬▬ About SENNEBOGEN ▬▬▬▬▬
SENNEBOGEN is a global leader in material handling and crane technology, offering a full range of material handlers, duty cycle crawler cranes, crawler cranes, telescopic cranes, and harbor cranes. Founded over 70 years ago, this family-owned company is known for its innovation, durability, and efficiency in industries such as scrap recycling, port logistics, timber handling, demolition, and construction.
With production sites in Germany and Hungary and subsidiaries in the USA and Singapore, SENNEBOGEN delivers cutting-edge solutions, including energy-efficient electric material handlers and custom-built machines for specialized applications. Our commitment to sustainability and customer-focused engineering makes us a trusted partner in the industry.
Subscribe to our channel to stay up to date with the latest machine innovations, real-world applications, and customer success stories.

The bearing clearance monitoring system by Liebherr is a digital condition monitoring for slewing bearings, which is ideal for use in various applications, from mining and material handling up to maritime equipment. The BCM can be used to measure bearing wear in axial and radial directions, as well as tilting clearance. Such a digital system does not only ensure flexibility in measurement, but also reduced downtime, lower costs in maintenance and, above all, increased protection of personnel. 

The focus of digital clearance maintenance lies on personnel safety. Since the measuring devices are already permanently installed on the bearing, service technicians will not have to mount dial gauges or other measuring devices directly onto the slewing bearing in dangerous areas under the excavator or other machines. An additional advantage is the fact that measurements can be carried out at any time autonomously, without the help of external service providers.

Smart, integrated and remote, the bearing clearance monitoring is a small helper with great effects.

Discover Liebherr Mining's Autonomous Haulage Solution (AHS), co-developed with Fortescue. The AHS, part of Liebherr's IoMine integrated operations technology portfolio, is transforming mining operations by combining advanced automation with real-time data insights to enhance productivity, safety and efficiency. This innovative ecosystem includes an integrated Fleet Management System (FMS) and Machine Guidance System (MGS). The Fleet Management System (FMS) integrates mining operations to boost productivity, optimise haulage assignments and maximise fleet utilisation – all of which helps to reduce non-productive time across the entire load-haul-dump value chain. The MGS delivers critical material information to minimise ore variability and dilution, improving overall performance.

​La nueva grúa sobre orugas de vía estrecha LR 1700-1.0W de Grúas Aguado demostró todas sus capacidades en su primer trabajo, con el montaje de ocho aerogeneradores en el parque eólico Cascante, en Navarra, con alturas de buje de 119 metros. Sin embargo, la nueva grúa de 700 toneladas no está ni mucho menos al límite de su rendimiento, ya que está diseñada para el montaje de modernos aerogeneradores con alturas de buje de hasta 170 metros. Ofrece capacidades de carga y alturas de buje significativamente mayores que las de su predecesora, la LR 1600/2-W. Todo esto es posible gracias a un chasis más potente, así como a los tramos de pluma de celosía, tipo H, de 3,5 metros de ancho situados en la base de la pluma principal que aumentan la estabilidad lateral de todo el conjunto. Liebherr también ofrece la LR 1700-1.0W con plumín abatible. Esta opción no estaba disponible para su predecesora.

​Der neue Schmalspur Raupenkran LR 1700-1.0W des spanischen Kunden Aguado kann seine Leistungsfähigkeit bereits bei seinem ersten Einsatz unter Beweis stellen: Bei der Montage von acht Windkraftanlagen im Windpark Cascante in Navarra mit Nabenhöhen von 119 Metern. Damit kommt der neue 700-Tonner allerdings längst nicht an seine Leistungsgrenze, denn er ist auf die Montage moderner Windkraftanlagen bis Nabenhöhen von 170 Metern ausgelegt. Er bietet deutlich höhere Tragkräfte und Hubhöhen als sein Vorgänger LR 1600/2-W. Die Basis dafür sind die stärkere Grundmaschine sowie die 3,5 Meter breiten H-Gitterstücke im unteren Bereich des Hauptauslegers, die die Seitenstabilität des gesamten Systems erhöhen. Liebherr bietet den LR 1700-1.0W auch mit Wippspitze an. Diese Option gab es beim Vorgänger nicht.

​The new LR 1700-1.0W narrow-track crawler crane from Spanish customer Aguado is already proving its capabilities on its first job: during the assembly of eight wind turbines at the Cascante wind farm in Navarra with hub heights of 119 meters. However, the new 700-tonn-crane is nowhere near its performance limit, as it is designed for the assembly of modern wind turbines with hub heights of up to 170 meters. It offers significantly higher load capacities and hub heights than its predecessor, the LR 1600/2-W. The basis for this is a more powerful basic machine as well as the 3.5-meter-wide H-lattice type sections in the lower area of the main boom, which increase the lateral stability of the entire system. Liebherr also offers the LR 1700-1.0W with a luffing jib. This option was not available for its predecessor.

Mit dem Tower Crane OS 2 sind sie auf dem neusten Stand der Technik. Schon heute erfüllt diese Steuerung die Anforderungen von morgen. Außerdem bringt sie Innovation und Sicherheit auf Ihre Baustelle.

Auf der Bauma 2004 präsentierte Liebherr in München den Gittermast-Mobilkran LG 1750, der die Vorteile eines Mobilkranes mit der Tragkraft eines 750-Tonnen-Gittermastkrans vereinigte. In rot-weißer Lackierung stand er auf der Messe und ging danach an Nolte Auto-Krane in Hannover. Genau 20 Jahre später erhält derselbe Kunde den Nachfolger LG 1800-1.0 mit demselben KFZ-Kennzeichen. Der Fahrer hat denselben Nachnamen wie damals: Rainer Schlesner ist der Sohn des einstigen Fahrers Detlef.

Im Laufe von zwei Jahrzehnten hat sich der LG 1750 zu einer Legende im Kranmarkt entwickelt. Da der neue 800-Tonner dessen Leistung deutlich übertrifft, hat der neue LG 1800-1.0 den Slogan „The legend grows“ bekommen. Darüber hinaus verfügt der Neue LG über mondernste Krantechnologie wie V-Frame®, VarioTray, ZF-Getriebe Traxon Torque mit ECOdrive und WindSpeed Load Charts.

At Bauma 2004 in Munich, Liebherr presented the LG 1750 lattice boom mobile crane, which combined the advantages of a mobile crane with the lifting capacity of a 750-tonne lattice boom crane. Painted in red and white, it was on display at the trade fair and then went to Nolte Auto-Krane in Hanover. Exactly 20 years later, the same customer received the successor LG 1800-1.0 with the same license plate. The driver has the same surname as back then: Rainer Schlesner is the son of the former driver Detlef.

Over the course of two decades, the LG 1750 has become a legend in the crane market. As the new 800-tonner clearly exceeds its performance, the new LG 1800-1.0 has been given the slogan "The legend grows". The new crane also features state-of-the-art crane technology such as V-Frame®, VarioTray, ZF Traxon Torque transmission with ECOdrive and WindSpeed Load Charts.LG, 800 tons, lattice boom crane, wind turbine, wind power, lattice boom, Nolte, LG 1800-1.0, wind farm, repowering, V-Frame, VarioTray, The legend grows, Windspeed load Charts.

Moderator Sebastian Höffner wirft mit abwechslungsreichen Gästen einen Blick zurück auf das Jahr 2024. 
Zu Gast im Löwen Hotel im Montafon (Österreich) war Steffen Günther, Mitglied des Direktoriums der Firmengruppe Liebherr. Er erklärt, warum die Diversifizierung ein wesentliches Merkmal der Firmengruppe ist, berichtet über wegweisende Investitionen und wirft einen Blick in die Zukunft. 
Dr. Jörg Lukowski, Executive Vice President für Vertrieb und Marketing im Produktsegment Mining, gibt Einblicke in einen historischen Vertrag über 475 Mining-Maschinen, der die Branche revolutioniert. Er beleuchtet technische Entwicklungen und die hohen Ansprüche, die Liebherr an sich selbst stellt. 
Sportlich wurde es für Sebastian Höffner bei seinem Interview mit Tischtennis-Star Timo Boll. Der Ausnahmesportler beendet nach mehreren Jahrzehnten seine Karriere und blickt noch einmal auf seine Lieblingsmomente zurück. Zudem wird die inspirierende Geschichte von Victoria Santacruz erzählt, die aus Ecuador zu Liebherr nach Lindenberg kam, um eine Ausbildung zu machen und sich trotz einiger Hürden erfolgreich eingelebt hat.

The first issue of our video magazine 2025 starts with our powerhouse on 2 axles. In the "Mobile and crawler cranes" category (start 00:40), an rough-terrain LRT 1100-2.1 supports an LG 1750 in the construction of four wind turbines. Then, in the "In focus" category (start 02:35), we move on to our crawler crane test yard, where Matthias Waidmann introduces us to the battery-powered pin-pulling cylinder and its advantages. We celebrate a special anniversary in our next article (start 05:33): In 2004, our customer Nolte ordered the first LG 1750. After 20 years, the successor model to this legend, the LG 1800-1.0, has rolled off the production line and Nolte has once again added the first model to its fleet. At the end of our video magazine (start: 07:56), our Managing Director of Construction, Dr. Hamme, gives us an outlook on the upcoming Bauma in Munich.

​Den Einstieg in die erste Ausgabe unseres Videomagazins für 2025 starten wir mit unserem flexiblen Kraftpaket auf 2 Achsen. Ein geländegängiger LRT 1100-2.1 unterstützt in der Kategorie „Mobil- und Raupenkrane“ (Start 00:40), einen LG 1750 beim Bau von vier Windenergie-Anlagen. Auf der Bauma 2025 stellt Liebherr den LTM 1150-5.4 vor, der auf die neue Steuerungsgeneration LICCON3 umgestellt wurde. Besonderes Highlight ist die Variante LTM 1150-5.4E mit elektrischem Antrieb, mit dem die Kranbewegungen emissionsfrei und mit reduzierter Geräuschbelastung ausgeführt werden. Mit einer integrierten Batterie kann der Kran einerseits bis zu vier Stunden ohne Stromanschluss autark arbeiten, zum anderen genügt eine geringe Anschlussleistung auf der Baustelle, um die volle Kranleistung zu entfalten, da die Batterie als effizienter Puffer dient. Der LTM 1150-5.4E erfüllt die Anforderungen von „Zero Emission-Baustellen“ und vereint Nachhaltigkeit mit höchster Effizienz.

​Der Teleskop-Raupenkran der LTR-Baureihe vereint die Vorteile der All-Terrain-Krane und der Raupenkrane. Durch die hervorragende Manövrierbarkeit des Raupenfahrwerks können LTR-Krane problemlos in jedem Gelände eingesetzt werden. Eine Abstützung wie beim All-Terrain-Kran ist durch das Raupenfahrwerk nicht nötig. Daher kam in Polperro, im Süden von Großbritannien, ein LTR 1220 von unserem Kunden Select auf einem Hubschiff zum Einsatz. Mit seinen Abmaßen von 9,50 m x 7,60 m nahm der Kran weniger Platz auf dem Hubschiff ein als ein vergleichbarer All-Terrain-Kran. Der Teleskop-Raupenkran unterstützte vor Ort mit seinem 60 Meter Teleskopausleger und seiner Klappspitze beim Rückbau eines 35 m langen Abflussrohrs, welches anschließend mit Beton vergossen werden musste.

​The telescopic crawler crane of the LTR series combines the advantages of all-terrain cranes and crawler cranes. Thanks to the excellent manoeuvrability of the crawler chassis, LTR cranes can be used on any terrain without any problems. The crawler undercarriage eliminates the need for stabilisers, as is the case with all-terrain cranes. This is why an LTR 1220 from our customer Select was used on a jack-up vessel in Polperro, in the south of the UK. With its dimensions of 9.50 m x 7.60 m, the crane took up less space on the jack-up vessel than a comparable all-terrain crane. With its 60 metre telescopic boom and folding jib, the telescopic crawler crane provided on-site support for the dismantling of a 35 m long drainage pipe, which then had to be filled with concrete.

In loud and complex work environments such as construction sites, the risk of collisions between machines and people is particularly high. This makes it even more important to always keep an overview. This is precisely where the digital LiXplore® Bird's Eye surround view system comes in: it supports machine operators with a complete overview, ensuring greater safety and efficiency in their daily work.
High-resolution full HD images provide a crystal clear surround view, while the robust system components remain reliable and ready for use even under extreme conditions. Intelligent, AI-based person detection identifies people in the danger zone at an early stage, helping to effectively prevent accidents. In addition to the 360° surround view system, our camera-monitor systems enable the view to be expanded flexibly by using up to six cameras to provide a comprehensive view of the front, sides and rear.

​We discovered one of our LRT 1100-2.1 rough-terrain cranes working on a wind farm pretty much in the dead centre of Germany, in the federal state of Hesse. This powerful, rough terrain crane, which is usually seen in quarries, open-cast mines or handling heavy goods, was providing support for a lattice boom mobile crane involved in the erection of four huge wind turbines. The versatile two-axle vehicle was used both for the set-up work on the lattice boom mobile crane and for the pre-assembly of individual components such as the nacelle. However, the benefits of the extremely manoeuvrable rough terrain crane, which can be moved whilst holding a load, really came into their own for moving the suspended ballast by the LG 1750.

Alarm für den Hubschrauber Christoph Regensburg der DRF Luftrettung: Jetzt kommt es auf jede Sekunde und jeden Handgriff an. Pilot Christian Daxer prüft die Wetterverhältnisse, denn im Regensburger Umland ist es oft neblig. Er muss mindestens 800 m weit sehen können, um tagsüber zu starten. Ist das garantiert, führt Christian Daxer die notwendigen Checks im Cockpit durch. Dabei unterstützt ihn ein Notfallsanitäter mit Zusatzausbildung. Die leitende Ärztin Katrin Judemann inspiziert währenddessen das Äußere der H145 – einem hochmodernen Hubschrauber von Airbus. Kurz darauf beginnen sich die Rotorblätter zu drehen, die Ärztin steigt ein, die H145 hebt ab. In nur zwei Minuten sind Menschen und Maschine einsatzbereit.
Wir werfen einen Blick hinter die Kulissen der DRF Luftrettung und zeigen, welche Schlüsselrolle die Liebherr-Technik spielt.

In lauten und unübersichtlichen Arbeitsumgebungen wie auf Baustellen ist die Gefahr von Kollisionen zwischen Maschinen und Personen besonders hoch. Umso wichtiger ist es, jederzeit den Überblick zu behalten. Genau hier setzt das digitale  Surround-View-System LiXplore® Bird's Eye an: Es unterstützt Maschinenbediener:innen mit einer umfassenden Sicht und sorgt so für mehr Sicherheit und Effizienz im Arbeitsalltag.

Hochauflösende Full-HD-Bilder liefern eine gestochen scharfe Rundumsicht, während die robusten Systemkomponenten auch unter extremen Bedingungen zuverlässig und einsatzbereit bleiben. Die intelligente, KI-basierte Personenerkennung identifiziert Personen frühzeitig im Gefahrenbereich und hilft so, Unfälle effektiv zu vermeiden. Neben dem 360°-Rundumsichtsystem ermöglichen unsere Kamera-Monitor-Systeme eine flexible Erweiterung des Sichtfelds durch den Einsatz von bis zu sechs Kameras und bieten eine umfassende Ansicht des Front-, Seiten- und Rückfahrbereichs.

Entdecken Sie, wie unser Kamerasysteme LiXplore® die Effizienz steigern und für klare Sicht sorgen: https://www.liebherr.com/lixplore

Vergessen Sie nicht, unseren Kanal zu liken, zu teilen und zu abonnieren, um über alle unsere neuesten Projekte und Innovationen auf dem Laufenden zu bleiben.

Südlich der portugiesischen Hauptstadt Lissabon wurde ein riesiges Kühllager errichtet. Den Betonfertigbau des 33.000 Quadratmeter messenden Gebäudes hat ein neuer Teleskop-Raupenkran unseres Kunden Transgrua bewerkstelligt. Der LTR 1100 mit seiner Fähigkeit, unter Last zu verfahren und sich schnell neu zu positionieren, hat dem Baustellenablauf eine höhere Geschwindigkeit verpasst. Der Kran steht meist schon in Position wenn ein Schwertransport mit Bauteilen eintrifft. Anschließend werden die Wandelemente angehängt, über die Gebäudehöhe gezogen und von oben in die Führungen der stehenden Pfeiler geführt. Kann ein Betonteil nicht sofort installiert werden, wird es am Haken des LTR 1100 kurzerhand dorthin gefahren, wo es später gebraucht wird.

​A huge cold storage facility was built south of the Portuguese capital Lisbon. A new telescopic crawler crane owned by our customer Transgrua carried out the precast concrete construction of the 33,000-square-metre building. The LTR 1100, with its ability to move under load and reposition itself quickly, increased the speed of the construction site processes. The crane is usually already in position when a heavy goods transport with components arrives. The wall elements are then attached, pulled over the height of the building and guided into the guides of the upright pillars from above. If a concrete element cannot be installed immediately, it is simply moved to where it is needed later on the hook of the LTR 1100.

Together with one of our LTM 1230-5.1 cranes, we will take you on a picturesque journey to the north of Great Britain. To be more precise: on a crane journey through Scotland - the native country of single malt. The journey starts not far from the legendary Loch Ness and its monster. Our business partner and customer, Stoddart Crane Hire, have their base slightly to the north, in Muir of Ord, a village in the Highlands. From here, the busy family owned company operates its mobile cranes throughout Scotland and – quite literally – far beyond, as one of their specialties is crane work on the numerous islands off the Scottish coast. Accompany the Stoddart crew on their expedition to the island of Jura off the west coast  to install a new boiler for the modernisation of the distillery.

Opinions often differ when it comes to fitness – there's strength training, endurance workouts, and everything in between. But when it comes to preparing our offshore cranes for operation, there's only one programme that counts: a full-scale performance test. 💪

Before these offshore giants begin their mission at sea, our two BOS 4200 cranes go through a demanding workout at our test bed in Rostock, Germany. Every movement, every function is put under the microscope – from slewing to hoisting. Like elite athletes in training, the cranes must prove their strength, precision, and coordination.

Project Manager Raik Wichmann takes you behind the scenes and walks you through the cranes' technical highlights and performance capabilities. Meanwhile, his colleagues are inside the cranes, conducting the tests that result in an impressive choreography of engineering precision.

Each crane features:

A safe working load of 60 tonnes
A boom length of 70 metres
Easy access to all inspection and maintenance points
Custom drive options: electro-hydraulic, diesel-hydraulic or fully electric
They've been built together, tested together – and will stay together. Like twins, or an old married couple, they share a bond that continues offshore. They're set to embark on their next chapter side by side.

These twin cranes will soon be in operation on one of the world's largest heavy-lift jack-up vessels, supporting offshore decommissioning operations. Their purpose? Contributing to a cleaner, more sustainable marine environment by helping remove complex offshore platforms.

With over 1,000 Liebherr offshore cranes in operation worldwide, our cranes are built for performance, precision, and endurance – proudly engineered and manufactured in Germany.

Step into the world of heavy lifting with our TCC 78000 – one of the most powerful gantry cranes ever built. Since its inauguration in 2019, this rail-mounted heavy-duty crane has become a vital asset at the Port of Rostock, handling a wide range of complex and oversized cargo.

This showreel captures the TCC 78000 in action across multiple operations. From lifting massive monopiles for offshore wind farms to handling heavy transformers, Liebherr cranes, and other challenging loads. Each sequence demonstrates the crane's strength, precision, and versatility.

Filmed with a combination of aerial drone footage and ground-level views, the video offers a unique look at the crane's performance in real-world conditions. Whether supporting renewable energy projects or managing intricate logistics, the TCC 78000 delivers reliable results with every lift.

The TCC 78000 runs on a double-rail gantry system with a track gauge of 30 meters and operates along a 420-metre-long rail track beside the quay. The berth provides optimal access for vessels up to 300 metres in length, 45 metres in width, and with a draught of up to 13 metres. Nearby storage areas with high load-bearing capacity further enhance the operational flexibility and efficiency of handling heavy and oversized cargo.

With a lifting capacity of up to 1,600 tonnes and a hook height of up to 112 metres, the TCC 78000 is designed to meet the demands of modern heavy cargo handling. Its innovative design and engineering excellence make it a key player in the future of port logistics.

📍Location: Port of Rostock, Germany

Step into the future of crane operator training with LiSIM move – a compact, portable simulator that turns any table into a fully immersive training station.
Designed for maximum flexibility, LiSIM move combines proven simulation technology with portable hardware. It delivers a realistic, responsive training experience using authentic crane controls, motion feedback, and virtual reality.

See how LiSIM move transforms any space into a high-tech training ground – whether at the training centre, in the forest, or by the sea. No crane yard required.

In a safe, stress-free environment, operators can practise handling various crane types. The versatile simulation accurately replicates a wide range of scenarios and environmental conditions for maximum realism and lasting learning success.

Key features include:
• Compact and portable – train anytime, anywhere
• Authentic controls for a genuine operating experience
• Dynamic motion simulation for realistic feedback
• Fully immersive virtual reality environment

Alternatively, fully automatic lubrication can be provided by a cartridge pump integrated in the grab. It is also possible to lubricate the grab manually via a central, easily accessible lubrication point.

Discover how the first Liebherr LB 30 Unplugged is
making an impact in Australia. Operated on the M80 Ring Road Completion in Melbourne by Acciona-Geotech team — this is the first time the electric rig has been used in the region. 

Part of Liebherr’s unplugged series, the LB 30 unplugged brings a fresh approach to deep foundation work, combining zero local emissions with impressive power and efficiency. In fact, it offers even more power than its diesel counterpart, making it well-equipped for the challenging demands of this major infrastructure project. 
 
With a quiet electric drive, reduced maintenance needs, and user-friendly operation, the LB 30 unplugged has quickly proven its value on site. The project highlights how electric construction equipment can deliver real performance while supporting more sustainable building practices. 
 
This project marks an important step toward more sustainable construction future, showing how electric alternatives can be both practical and powerful in large-scale infrastructure work.
